meanings.definition: A person who votes in an election.
meanings.sent1: The voters lined up outside the polling station.
meanings.sent2: The voters cast their ballots in the election.
meanings.sent3: The voters were excited to participate in the democratic process.
meanings.sent4: The power of voters can shape the future of a nation.
meanings.sent5: The responsibility of voters is crucial for a functioning democracy.

meanings.definition: The collective body of people who have the right to vote.
meanings.sent1: All voters must register to vote in the upcoming election.
meanings.sent2: The voters' turnout was high during the presidential election.
meanings.sent3: The voters collectively decided the outcome of the election.
meanings.sent4: The unity of voters can bring about significant change.
meanings.sent5: The diversity of voters reflects the population's varied opinions.
